newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ govt to offer NZ$100 mln 02/01 bonds at tender.
newsitem.headline: NZ govt to offer NZ$100 mln 02/01 bonds at tender.

text.p: The New Zealand government will offer only the February 2001 maturity in a NZ$100 million bond tender on August 29, the Reserve Bank said on Thursday.
The bank also said it would buy NZ$50 million of 02/01s for its own portfolio.
The tender is the first since the Debt Management Office announced it was halving the 1996-97 domestic bond programme to NZ$1 billion following the government's sale of Forestry Corporation.

Dealers speculated after the DMO's announcement that the cutback may mean no further issuance of November 2006 bonds. Net proceeds to the government from the sale of Forestry Corp to a Fletcher Challenge-led consortium totalled $1.6 billion, to be used for repaying debt.
Details (amounts in millions of NZ dollars).
Bids close 11.30 a.m. on Thursday August 29 (2330 GMT Wednesday) and results will be announced at 1.00 p.m. (0100 GMT) the same day. -- Wellington Newsroom (64 4) 4734746
